data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Kakuna and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

attacks.name: Sudden Sting
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Kakuna during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Cacnea
data.flavorText: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.

attacks.name: Sucker Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Karrablast
data.flavorText: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

abilities.name: Shell On
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Shelmet from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Shelmet
data.flavorText: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cacturne
data.flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

attacks.name: Spike Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Hunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

data.name: Accelgor
data.flavorText: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.

data.name: Skiddo
data.flavorText: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

data.name: Numel
data.flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Alolan Marowak
data.flavorText: The bones it possesses were once its mother's. Its mother's regrets have become like a vengeful spirit protecting this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dance of Flames
attacks.text: For each Energy attached to your opponent's Pokémon, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Burning Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If either of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Gogoat
data.flavorText: It can tell how its trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathetic sense lets them run as if one being.

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.

abilities.name: Escape
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.name: Camerupt
data.flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years—or whenever it becomes really angry.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you'll soon grow tired of seeing them.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Waterfall Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Gyarados-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Draconic Disaster
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Dread Storm-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Piloswine
data.flavorText: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 90 damage from it.

data.name: Swinub
data.flavorText: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

data.name: Mamoswine
data.flavorText: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Forceful Tackle
attacks.text: You may put up to 9 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

data.name: Remoraid
data.flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

data.name: Octillery
data.flavorText: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

attacks.name: Ink Spit
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Special Artillery
attacks.text: You may discard a Special Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Corphish
data.flavorText: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.

data.name: Crawdaunt
data.flavorText: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.

attacks.name: Double Claws
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Feebas
data.flavorText: A tough Pokémon that is perfectly fine even in dirty water. However, due to its ragged, shabby appearance, it isn't popular.

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Regice
data.flavorText: It is said to have slept in a glacier for thousands of years. Its body can't be melted, even by magma.

abilities.name: Iceberg Shield
abilities.text: If you have Regirock in play, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Stage 2 Pokémon.

data.name: Milotic
data.flavorText: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.

attacks.name: TLC
attacks.text: Shuffle 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into their deck.

attacks.name: Ocean Cyclone
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

attacks.name: Pika Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Alolan Raichu
data.flavorText: It only evolves to this form in the Alola region. According to researchers, its diet is one of the causes of this change.

abilities.name: Surge Surfer
abilities.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Shellos
data.flavorText: For the most part, it makes its home along the seashore. Its color and form differ according to its habitat and the quality of its food.

attacks.name: Regeneration
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Graveler
data.flavorText: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of part of its body.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

data.name: Alolan Geodude
data.flavorText: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Alolan Golem-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Electromagnetic Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Heavy Rock-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Emolga
data.flavorText: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.

attacks.name: Energy Catch
attacks.text: Put 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Lightning Pokémon.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.

abilities.name: Gnawing Curse
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Mismagius
data.flavorText: It appears as if from nowhere—muttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.

attacks.name: Chaos Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Dark Arts
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Spoink
data.flavorText: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

data.name: Grumpig
data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Confused.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Chimecho
data.flavorText: It uses the sucker on its head to hang from a tree or from eaves. It can produce seven different tones.

attacks.name: Bell of Silence
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon that has an Ability from their hand during their next turn.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Gourgeist
data.flavorText: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Pumpkin Bomb
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may discard any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Pumpkaboo
data.flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.

attacks.name: Fixer of the Forest
attacks.text: Put 3 Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Nihilego-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Empty Light
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Symbiont-GX
attacks.text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.

attacks.name: Three-Step Strike
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.

attacks.name: Lucha Fight
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Cubone
data.flavorText: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Regirock
data.flavorText: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.

abilities.name: Rock Peak Growl
abilities.text: Your Registeel's attacks do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Tough Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

data.name: Gastrodon
data.flavorText: It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if parts of it are bitten off by fish Pokémon, it will return to normal within a few hours.

attacks.name: Eerie Fluid
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Bewear
data.flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

abilities.name: Fluffy
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from the attacks of your opponent's non-Fire Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Buzzwole-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Absorption-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your remaining Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: Around dawn, its ominous howl echoes through the area to announce that this is its territory.

data.name: Deino
data.flavorText: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Houndoom
data.flavorText: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Puncturing Fangs
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Zweilous
data.flavorText: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.name: Hydreigon
data.flavorText: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.

abilities.name: Weed Out
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 3 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, discard your other Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Destruction
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Guzzlord-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Eat Sloppily
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glutton-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Guzzlord-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Eat Sloppily
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glutton-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mawile
data.flavorText: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lairon
data.flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

data.name: Aggron
data.flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

attacks.name: Revenge Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Registeel
data.flavorText: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.

attacks.name: Turbo Arm
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Hand
attacks.text: If Regice is on your Bench, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Kartana-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Slice Off
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gale Blade
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Blade-GX
attacks.text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you'll become sleepy right away.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Escavalier
data.flavorText: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Punishing Slap
attacks.text: If any of your opponent's Pokémon have any Darkness Energy attached to them, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Xerneas
data.flavorText: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bright Horns
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Bright Horns during your next turn.

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tropical Head
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dragon Hammer
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Tower-Go-Round-GX
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Hakamo-o
data.flavorText: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.

attacks.name: Noble Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Jangmo-o
data.flavorText: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.

data.name: Kommo-o
data.flavorText: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.

attacks.name: War Cry
attacks.text: If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Clanging Scales
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Swablu
data.flavorText: For some reason, it likes to land on people's heads softly and act like it's a hat.

data.name: Altaria
data.flavorText: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you're in a dream.

attacks.name: Draco Melody
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Dragon Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Starly
data.flavorText: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.

attacks.name: Bug Search
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Miltank
data.flavorText: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank's.

abilities.name: Moomoo Malt
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, heal 90 damage from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sitdown Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Staraptor
data.flavorText: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sky Hunting
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by the damage from this attack, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Staravia
data.flavorText: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

data.name: Regigigas
data.flavorText: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

abilities.name: Seal of Antiquity
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't attack unless Regirock, Regice, and Registeel are on your Bench.

attacks.name: Giant Stomp
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

data.name: Regigigas
data.flavorText: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

abilities.name: Seal of Antiquity
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't attack unless Regirock, Regice, and Registeel are on your Bench.

attacks.name: Giant Stomp
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

data.name: Minccino
data.flavorText: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Cinccino
data.flavorText: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.

attacks.name: Amazing Plea
attacks.text: Choose 2 cards from your discard pile. Then, ask your opponent if you may put them into your hand. If yes, put those cards into your hand. If no, this attack does 80 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Diggersby
data.flavorText: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Type: Null
data.flavorText: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Dashing Pouch
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to discards Energy for its Retreat Cost, put that Energy into your hand instead of the discard pile.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Gyro Unit
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Turbo Drive
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rebel-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Counter Catcher
rules: You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Devoured Field
rules: The attacks of Darkness Pokémon and Dragon Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Fighting Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Fighting Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gladion
rules: Look at your face-down Prize cards and put 1 of them into your hand. Then, shuffle this Gladion into your remaining Prize cards and put them back face down. If you didn't play this Gladion from your hand, it does nothing.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lusamine
rules: Put 2 in any combination of Supporter and Stadium cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Peeking Red Card
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may have your opponent count the cards in their hand, shuffle those cards into their deck, then draw that many cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sea of Nothingness
rules: Special Conditions are not removed when Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) evolve or devolve.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Psychic Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Psychic Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Counter Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 2 Energy at a time.

data.name: Gyarados-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Draconic Disaster
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Dread Storm-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Golem-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Electromagnetic Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Heavy Rock-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Nihilego-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Empty Light
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Symbiont-GX
attacks.text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Guzzlord-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Eat Sloppily
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glutton-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gladion
rules: Look at your face-down Prize cards and put 1 of them into your hand. Then, shuffle this Gladion into your remaining Prize cards and put them back face down. If you didn't play this Gladion from your hand, it does nothing.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tropical Head
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dragon Hammer
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Tower-Go-Round-GX
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Gyro Unit
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Rebel-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Buzzwole-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Absorption-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your remaining Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Kartana-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Slice Off
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gale Blade
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Blade-GX
attacks.text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lusamine
rules: Put 2 in any combination of Supporter and Stadium cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Olivia
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon-GX, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Warp Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Counter Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 2 Energy at a time.

data.name: Wishful Baton
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, move up to 3 basic Energy cards from that Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Counter Catcher
rules: You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
